com.googlecode.kevinarpe.papaya.swing

Class PJComponentTextParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.googlecode.kevinarpe.papaya.swing.PJComponentTextParser

  • @FullyTested
public final class PJComponentTextParser
extends Object
    Parses widget text labels for optional mnemonics, e.g., "Save &As...". This class should be used by widget constructors that accept text labels and related setText(String) methods. The ampersand character, '&', is used before the mnemonic character, e.g., "Save &As..." The sequence "&&" will produce a single, literal ampersand character: '&'.

    Text is tested for HTML via BasicHTML.isHTMLString(String). As of writing, this test is very simple: If the string exactly starts with "<html>" then it is HTML. If the text is not HTML, but contains newlines, after parsing the mnemonic, the text is converted to HTML (prepend "<html>" and convert "<" to "&lt;") and newlines are converted to "<br>". Additionally, if a mnemonic character was found, the character is surrounded by "<u>" and "</u>" to simulate the underline effect common on most windowing systems for keyboard mnemonics.

    A text label may contain exactly zero or one marked mnemonic character, but an unlimited number of escaped markers ("&&").

    When necessary, Latin characters that use diacritical marks, such as the letter å, are handled correctly through Unicode decomposition. Example: å -> a & ̊

    Example: "Save &As..."

    • textBeforeParse: "Save &As..."
    • isHTMLStringBeforeParse: false
    • textAfterParse: "Save As..."
    • isHTMLStringAfterParse: false
    • hasMnemonic: true
    • mnemonicKeyChar: 'A'
    • mnemonicKeyCode: KeyEvent.VK_A
    • mnemonicIndex: 5
    Example: "S&ave As..."
    • textBeforeParse: "S&ave As..."
    • isHTMLStringBeforeParse: false
    • textAfterParse: "Save As..."
    • isHTMLStringAfterParse: false
    • hasMnemonic: true
    • mnemonicKeyChar: 'a'
    • mnemonicKeyCode: KeyEvent.VK_A
    • mnemonicIndex: 1
    Example: "H&åkon"
    • textBeforeParse: "H&åkon"
    • isHTMLStringBeforeParse: false
    • textAfterParse: "Håkon"
    • isHTMLStringAfterParse: false
    • hasMnemonic: true
    • mnemonicKeyChar: 'å'
    • mnemonicKeyCode: KeyEvent.VK_A
    • mnemonicIndex: 1
    Example: "Sample"
    • textBeforeParse: "Sample"
    • isHTMLStringBeforeParse: false
    • textAfterParse: "Sample"
    • isHTMLStringAfterParse: false
    • hasMnemonic: false
    • mnemonicKeyChar: '␀'
    • mnemonicKeyCode: 0
    • mnemonicIndex: -1
    Example: "Sample && Example"
    • textBeforeParse: "Sample && Example"
    • isHTMLStringBeforeParse: false
    • textAfterParse: "Sample & Example"
    • isHTMLStringAfterParse: false
    • hasMnemonic: false
    • mnemonicKeyChar: '␀'
    • mnemonicKeyCode: 0
    • mnemonicIndex: -1
    Example: "Sample && &Example"
    • textBeforeParse: "Sample && &Example"
    • isHTMLStringBeforeParse: false
    • textAfterParse: "Sample & Example"
    • isHTMLStringAfterParse: false
    • hasMnemonic: true
    • mnemonicKeyChar: 'E'
    • mnemonicKeyCode: KeyEvent.VK_E
    • mnemonicIndex: 9
    Example: "<html><b>S</b>ample"
    • textBeforeParse: "<html><b>S</b>ample"
    • isHTMLStringBeforeParse: true
    • textAfterParse: "<html><b>S</b>ample"
    • isHTMLStringAfterParse: true
    • hasMnemonic: false
    • mnemonicKeyChar: '␀'
    • mnemonicKeyCode: 0
    • mnemonicIndex: -1
    Example: "Sample\nAnd\nExample"
    • textBeforeParse: "Sample\nAnd\nExample"
    • isHTMLStringBeforeParse: false
    • textAfterParse: "<html>Sample<br>And<br>Example"
    • isHTMLStringAfterParse: true
    • hasMnemonic: false
    • mnemonicKeyChar: '␀'
    • mnemonicKeyCode: 0
    • mnemonicIndex: -1
    Example: "Sample\nAnd\n&Example"
    • textBeforeParse: "Sample\nAnd\n&Example"
    • isHTMLStringBeforeParse: false
    • textAfterParse: "<html>Sample<br>And<br><u>E</u>xample"
    • isHTMLStringAfterParse: true
    • hasMnemonic: true
    • mnemonicKeyChar: 'E'
    • mnemonicKeyCode: KeyEvent.VK_E
    • mnemonicIndex: -1
    Example: null
    • textBeforeParse: null
    • isHTMLStringBeforeParse: false
    • textAfterParse: null
    • isHTMLStringAfterParse: false
    • hasMnemonic: false
    • mnemonicKeyChar: '␀'
    • mnemonicKeyCode: 0
    • mnemonicIndex: -1
    Example: ""
    • textBeforeParse: ""
    • isHTMLStringBeforeParse: false
    • textAfterParse: ""
    • isHTMLStringAfterParse: false
    • hasMnemonic: false
    • mnemonicKeyChar: '␀'
    • mnemonicKeyCode: 0
    • mnemonicIndex: -1
    Example: " "
    • textBeforeParse: " "
    • isHTMLStringBeforeParse: false
    • textAfterParse: " "
    • isHTMLStringAfterParse: false
    • hasMnemonic: false
    • mnemonicKeyChar: '␀'
    • mnemonicKeyCode: 0
    • mnemonicIndex: -1
    When setting the mnemonic for a button:
    • do not use mnemonicKeyChar with AbstractButton.setMnemonic(char);
    • instead, use mnemonicKeyCode with AbstractButton.setMnemonic(int)
    All instances of this class are fully immutable, thus thread-safe, and safe to store as static final constants.
    Author:
    Kevin Connor ARPE (kevinarpe@gmail.com)
    See Also:
    AbstractButton.setMnemonic(int), AbstractButton.setDisplayedMnemonicIndex(int), textBeforeParse, isHTMLStringBeforeParse, textAfterParse, isHTMLStringAfterParse, hasMnemonic, mnemonicKeyChar, mnemonicKeyCode, mnemonicIndex

      The Unicode character marked as the mnemonic character, e.g., "&Sample" marks S.

      Text label cleaned of mnemonic markers, e.g., "&Sample" -> "Sample".

    • Field Detail

      • MARKER

        public static final char MARKER
        The character used to mark a mnemonic, e.g., "&Sample" to mark S.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DEFAULT_MNEMONIC_KEY_CHAR

        public static final char DEFAULT_MNEMONIC_KEY_CHAR
        Default for field mnemonicKeyChar.

      • DEFAULT_MNEMONIC_KEY_CODE

        public static final int DEFAULT_MNEMONIC_KEY_CODE
        Default for field mnemonicKeyCode.

      • DEFAULT_MNEMONIC_INDEX

        public static final int DEFAULT_MNEMONIC_INDEX
        Default for field mnemonicIndex.

      • textBeforeParse

        public final String textBeforeParse
        Original text label to the constructor PJComponentTextParser(String). This text may contain mnemonic markers, e.g., "&Sample".
        See Also:
        textAfterParse

      • isHTMLStringBeforeParse

        public final boolean isHTMLStringBeforeParse
        If textBeforeParse is HTML string according to BasicHTML.isHTMLString(String).

      • textAfterParse

        public final String textAfterParse
        Text label cleaned of mnemonic markers, e.g., "&Sample" -> "Sample". Escaped marker chars will each be reduced to a single literal marker, e.g., "Sample && Example" -> "Sample & Example".

        This value is intended to be used with methods such as AbstractButton.setText(String).

        See Also:
        textBeforeParse

      • isHTMLStringAfterParse

        public final boolean isHTMLStringAfterParse
        If textAfterParse is HTML string according to BasicHTML.isHTMLString(String).

      • hasMnemonic

        public final boolean hasMnemonic
        If true, the original textBeforeParse has exactly one marked mnemonic character, e.g., "&Sample".

      • mnemonicKeyChar

        public final char mnemonicKeyChar
        The Unicode character marked as the mnemonic character, e.g., "&Sample" marks S.

        If hasMnemonic is false, this field has value DEFAULT_MNEMONIC_KEY_CHAR.

        When setting the mnemonic for a button:

        • do not use mnemonicKeyChar with AbstractButton.setMnemonic(char);
        • instead, use mnemonicKeyCode with AbstractButton.setMnemonic(int)
        See Also:
        hasMnemonic, mnemonicKeyCode, DEFAULT_MNEMONIC_KEY_CHAR

      • mnemonicKeyCode

        public final int mnemonicKeyCode
        The (case-insensitive) virtual key code for the marked mnemonic character, e.g., "&Sample" or "&sample" -> KeyEvent.VK_S.

        If hasMnemonic is false, this field has value DEFAULT_MNEMONIC_KEY_CODE.

        When setting the mnemonic for a button:

        • do not use mnemonicKeyChar with AbstractButton.setMnemonic(char);
        • instead, use mnemonicKeyCode with AbstractButton.setMnemonic(int)
        See Also:
        mnemonicKeyChar, mnemonicIndex, DEFAULT_MNEMONIC_KEY_CODE

      • mnemonicIndex

        public final int mnemonicIndex
        The index in textAfterParse for mnemonicKeyChar, e.g., "Sample && &Example" -> "Sample & Example" -> index of 'E' -> 9.

        If hasMnemonic is false, this field has value DEFAULT_MNEMONIC_INDEX.

        This value may be used with AbstractButton.setDisplayedMnemonicIndex(int).

        See Also:
        mnemonicKeyCode, DEFAULT_MNEMONIC_INDEX

    • Constructor Detail

      • PJComponentTextParser

        public PJComponentTextParser(String label)
        Parses a text label for a widget, such as a button, to extract mnemonic metadata. For examples, read the class docs.
        Parameters:
        label - text label to parse for mnemonic metadata. May be empty or null.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException -
        • if last character is a dangling mnemonic marker, e.g., "Sample&"
        • if a second character is marked as the mnemonic, e.g., "&Sa&mple"
        • if marked character does not have a virtual key code, e.g., "&大阪"
        See Also:
        PJComponentTextParser, textBeforeParse, isHTMLStringBeforeParse, textAfterParse, isHTMLStringAfterParse, hasMnemonic, mnemonicKeyChar, mnemonicKeyCode, mnemonicIndex
